qas.question: How did Nasser react to the news the the US and UK had blocked construction of th Aswan Dam?
What piece of infrastructure did Nasser propose to nationalize?
What was Nasser's cabinet's knowledge of the nationalization scheme before Nasser announced it?
When did the last British troops leave Egypt?

context: Nasser was informed of the British–American withdrawal via a news statement while aboard a plane returning to Cairo from Belgrade, and <a0_0>took great offense<a0_0/>. Although ideas for nationalizing the <a1_0>Suez Canal<a1_0/> were in the offing after the UK agreed to withdraw its military from Egypt in 1954 (the last British troops left on 13 June <a3_0>1956<a3_0/>), journalist Mohamed Hassanein Heikal asserts that Nasser made the final decision to nationalize the waterway between 19 and 20 July. Nasser himself would later state that he decided on 23 July, after studying the issue and deliberating with some of his advisers from the dissolved RCC, namely Boghdadi and technical specialist Mahmoud Younis, beginning on 21 July. The rest of the RCC's former members were informed of the decision on 24 July, while the bulk of the cabinet was <a2_0>unaware<a2_0/> of the nationalization scheme until hours before Nasser publicly announced it. According to Ramadan, Nasser's decision to nationalize the canal was a solitary decision, taken without consultation.
